Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Food Republic" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(October 2024)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Food Republic** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 大食代; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Dàshídài*) is a [food court](/wiki/Food_court) chain run by the [BreadTalk](/wiki/BreadTalk) Group based in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). CEO of Food Republic is Mr. Jenson Ong. The concept combines local [hawker](/wiki/Hawker_centre) fare with mini restaurants (some of which have exclusive seating) in an open dining concept. Some stalls are also run from standalone pushcarts. Food Republic's elaborate decor and furniture are designed to invoke a nostalgic [kampong](/wiki/Kampung) atmosphere. ## Locations There are currently fourteen branches in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), which are open at [Wisma Atria](/wiki/Wisma_Atria), 313@Somerset, [VivoCity](/wiki/VivoCity), [Suntec City](/wiki/Suntec_City), [NEX](/wiki/Nex,_Singapore), [Parkway Parade](/wiki/Parkway_Parade), [City Square](/wiki/City_Square_Shopping_Centre), BreadTalk IHQ, [Causeway Point](/wiki/Causeway_Point), [Westgate](/wiki/Westgate,_Singapore), [Shaw House](/wiki/Shaw_House_and_Centre), Manulife and [Capitol Piazza](/wiki/Capitol_Piazza). In addition, the group operates a food court by the name of Food Opera at [ION Orchard](/wiki/ION_Orchard) together with Tea Loft with high prices that have attracted much attention by the media and the general public. The Wisma Atria branch seats 900 people while the VivoCity one is slightly bigger and also has a Toast Box outlet attached. ### International operations The chain has five branches in [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong), which are located at Prudential Centre in [Jordan](/wiki/Jordan), [Citygate Outlets](/wiki/Citygate) in [Tung Chung](/wiki/Tung_Chung), [Silvercord](/wiki/Silvercord) in [Tsim Sha Tsui](/wiki/Tsim_Sha_Tsui), [Domain (Hong Kong)](/wiki/Domain_(Hong_Kong)) in [Yau Tong](/wiki/Yau_Tong) and [Olympian City](/wiki/Olympian_City) in [Tai Kok Tsui](/wiki/Tai_Kok_Tsui). Silvercord branch and Olympian City branch also have Toast Box outlets attached. Toast Box also has branches located at the basement level of [Times Square](/wiki/Times_Square_(Hong_Kong)) in [Causeway Bay](/wiki/Causeway_Bay) and On Shing Terrace of Taikoo Shing. BreadTalk has also had a branch in Viva Beijing, [Beijing](/wiki/Beijing), at which breadtalk is directly connected to. In [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia), there is a branch located at the basement level of [Pavilion Kuala Lumpur](/wiki/Pavilion_Kuala_Lumpur) in [Bukit Bintang](/wiki/Bukit_Bintang). It also opened its latest outlet in Malaysia at [Pavilion Bukit Jalil](/wiki/Pavilion_Bukit_Jalil), located at Level 1. In 2011, Food Republic opened ten branches in [Jakarta](/wiki/Jakarta), Indonesia: [Pacific Place](/wiki/Pacific_Place_Jakarta), [Grand Indonesia](/wiki/Grand_Indonesia_Shopping_Town), [Pondok Indah Mall 3](/wiki/Pondok_Indah_Mall), [Mal Kelapa Gading](/wiki/Mal_Kelapa_Gading), [Mall of Indonesia](/wiki/Mall_of_Indonesia), PIK Avenue, [Neo Soho Podomoro City](/wiki/Central_Park_Jakarta), [Lippo Mall Puri](/wiki/St._Moritz,_Jakarta), and Summarecon Mall Serpong. In 2012, Food Republic opened three branches in Taiwan: in Banchiao, Taipei City, and Kaohsiung. The most recent of the three opened in Taipei in the first floor of the Carrefour building in Neihu. Food Republic entered [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand) in 2012, with its first location at [CentralPlaza Grand Rama IX](/wiki/CentralPlaza_Grand_Rama_IX). It operated up to six branches in Bangkok, but began closing down in 2021. It is scheduled to exit the country by the end of 2024. In 2015, Food Republic opened 4 branches in [Tokyo](/wiki/Tokyo), Japan. In 2016, Food Republic opened a branch in [Disneytown](/wiki/Disneytown), which is a shopping district in [Shanghai Disney Resort](/wiki/Shanghai_Disney_Resort). In 2017, Food Republic opened 2 branches at [Shenzhen](/wiki/Shenzhen), China. ## Gallery - Channelnewsasia article on opening - Food Republic Official Site
